issue.title: Support SSL
issue.body: The most straightforward way would probably be to add a `lanuch_ssl` method to Rocket that takes a `T: hyper::net::SslServer`.

body: I am looking at implementing MTLS for a project that uses Rocket and wanted to know if I could be pointed in the right direction to start making these modification.
Looks like this will make it in for 0.4, thanks to @Kmoneal and @akuanti. Track progress in https://github.com/SergioBenitez/Rocket/pull/657.
Ah, unfortunately spoke to soon. Pushing to `0.5`, though this could also be in a `0.4` point release.

issue.title: Feature Request: Authenticated Origin Pulls

repository.name: vaultwarden
repository.description: Unofficial Bitwarden compatible server written in Rust, formerly known as bitwarden_rs

license.name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
It would be fantastic if there was a way to enable authenticated origin pulls, including the ability to set a valid certificate for them. This would allow us to secure our installations behind WAFs, like Cloudflare, and ensure nobody is able to get around that.

Apache example:
```apache
SSLVerifyClient require
SSLVerifyDepth 1
SSLCACertificateFile /path/to/origin-pull-ca.pem
```
Nginx example:
```nginx
ssl_client_certificate /etc/nginx/certs/cloudflare.crt;
ssl_verify_client on;
```
See for more info: https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/204899617

body: This is held up in the PR queue. Removing it as a milestone until further progress.
Can I somehow help with implementing this?

@faulesocke The latest effort is at https://github.com/SergioBenitez/Rocket/pull/1419. Feel free to ping the author and/or takeover.

Note that whatever implementation we go with, it must have the property that MTLS can be enabled and disabled per-route, via a request guard, as well as optionally for the entire application, likely via a fairing.
